content.description: Face climb with broken cracks and horizontal pockets
A broken crack system that leads to some big plates before finishing at the anchors
content.location: On Magnanimous Rock, The Greater Located about 50 yards Left from the Park Service trail that leads up to Crack In The Rocks from the lower parking area.

content.description: This route is basically a long V2 boulder problem.  Stick clip the bolt at the lip of the roof.  Start sitting and climb out the tiered roof on huge holds.  Use a spotter until it becomes reasonable for the belayer to take over.  Watch the swing!  Lower off shuts above the roof.
content.location: This is the large low tiered roof between Shell Shock and Slingblade.

content.description: A finger intensive hard start leads to narrow ledge with a sit-down rest (if you face out). Let the feeling return to your finger tips and move slightly left and up a short shallow dihedral (10+). A long stretch of 5.9 on golden sandstone leads to another rest beneath the crux bulge. Move out the right side of the bulge, traverse back left to an overhanging arete and make a big move to the thank-god clipping hold, a big flat horizontal ribbon of black patina.  Clip the bolts and puke.
content.location: Turn left as you exit the "Crack In The Rocks", head upstream for 50-100' and a locate a clean left-facing corner along the main wall (Bandersnatch). The lone sport route on the orange right-hand wall is Morpheus.

content.description: Good pro is available but is not obvious.

The obvious toothy crack filled with thin crunchy vertical flakes that interfere with the jams and gear.  The crack ends after 40'.  Transition to the slabby face which is dangerously runout and is the crux of the route.  When lowering off, a 60m rope will come up short, so tie a knot in the end of the rope.  The leader can lower into the tree and down climb about 20 feet.
content.location: Just before you reach the huge free standing flake is an obvious vertical crack.  A large tree is near the base of the route.

content.description: A steep pocketed route with fun thuggish moves
content.location: On Magnanimous Block, The Lesser about 30 yards right from the Park Service trail that leads up to Crack In The Rocks from the lower parking area.

content.description: Short and fun. Climbs through a water groove as you surmount the rounded top-out.  Be ready for the groove to be filled with leaves.
content.location: As you exit the Crack In The Rocks, turn right.  The route is between the arete and the low roof system (Sabre Dance).

content.description: A left facing crack to a vegetated ledge
This area is located upstream of the stairs.
